meanings.definition: To make someone annoyed or irritated.
meanings.sent1: His constant tapping on the desk would rile his classmates during the test.
meanings.sent2: The loud music next door started to rile up the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy would always find a way to rile up the old cat.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected delay in the schedule riled up the usually calm manager.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet would slowly rile up his nerves.

meanings.sent1: She would easily rile whenever someone criticized her work.
meanings.sent2: The child would rile up quickly when he didn't get his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man would rile up at the slightest inconvenience.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved issue continued to rile up his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise from the construction site would rile him up every morning.
